subject: Re: ClassNotFoundException
msgSnippet: Visual Age 3.5, JUnit 3.7 workspace classpath includes the JUnit jar and my project directory default.ini file: Name=junit Version=3
messageBody:
Visual Age 3.5, JUnit 3.7

workspace classpath includes the JUnit jar and my project directory

default.ini file:

"Name=junit
Version=3
Menu-Items=JUnit,junit.swingui.TestRunner, ;\
JUnit,junit.swingui.TestRunner,-c
Quick-Start-Items=JUnit,junit.swingui.TestRunner"

cheers for trying to help

--- In junit@y..., "Jason Rogers" <jason.rogers@t...> wrote:
> Are you saying that you are unable to run JUnit in VAJ at all.
Shouldn't be
> an issue. You definitely have something set up wrong. can you
tell us your
> setup (eg. what you are running, how, what's in your workspace
classpath,
> what your default.ini file looks like, etc.)
>
> -Jason
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: messy_head_2001@y... [mailto:messy_head_2001@y...]
> > Sent: Wednesday, August 22, 2001 11:42 AM
> > To: junit@y...
> > Subject: [junit] Re: ClassNotFoundException
> >
> >
> > Yeah I've definitely put the classpath in the TestRunner
> > class and
> > I've added my project to the workspace classpath in
VisualAge...
> >
> > but I think it must be a classpath issue, as if I run
> > JUnit from the
> > tools menu in Visual Age it cannot find any of my classes.
> >
> >
> >
> >
> > --- In junit@y..., Mark Meyers <markm@m...> wrote:
> > > Check if you start JUnit with the searchpath for
> > "myclass" in it's
> > > classpath...
> > >
> > > -----Original Message-----
> > > From: messy_head_2001@y... [mailto:messy_head_2001@y...]
> > > Sent: woensdag 22 augustus 2001 15:47
> > > To: junit@y...
> > > Subject: [junit] ClassNotFoundException
> > >
> > >
> > > I am trying to use JUnit to test a method which calls
> > >
> > > Class.forName("myClassName")
> > >
> > > however I get a ClassNotFoundException from this line of
code,
> > which
> > > works perfectly when not using JUnit.
> > >
> > > Any ideas??
> > >
> > > David.
> > >
> > >
